snippet: A combination of weak exports and slowly rising consumer spending prompted concerns among economists about sustaining even modest growth.
abstract: China's economy, after powerful recovery in late 2012, is unexpectedly faltering again; weak exports and slowly rising consumer spending prompt concerns among economists about sustaining even modest growth of 7.5 percent n coming years, government's current goal.
lead_paragraph: A combination of weak exports and slowly rising consumer spending prompted concerns among economists about sustaining even modest growth.

headline.seo: After a Strong Recovery, China’s Economy Unexpectedly Stumbles Again
headline.main: China’s Economy Unexpectedly Stumbles Again on Weak Export Results
headline.print_headline: China’s Economy Unexpectedly Stumbles Again on Weak Export Results
